content: I should probably buy some paintbrushes [Applause]
hey guys welcome back to another episode of black magic crafts today again we are
going back to basics last time on the basic series I talked about paint and
now it is time to talk about paintbrushes so your new crafter you
want to start building terrain and you are establishing your arsenal of tools
and supplies you go to the store place like Michaels pick up your paint and
brushes you go to the paintbrush aisle there's actually like seven aisles in
Michaels that have paint brushes so you go to one of the many aisles that have
paint brushes in Michaels and it's overwhelming there are a ton of options
some of them can be very expensive there are a lot of nice high quality brushes
available for you to buy have no fear it's way easier than you think to build
terrain especially terrain when you're just starting basic stuff like dungeon
tiles and hills and whatever you don't need good brushes you really really
really don't need good brushes you can avoid the art supply and craft store
entirely if you have no paintbrushes and you want to make your first set of
something like dungeon tiles go to the dollar store or Walmart or somewhere
that just sells cheap crap from China for cheap something like this is all
that you need this is a variety pack of random crappy paint brushes from
Dollarama but this type of thing you can find at any dollar store or big-box
store or whatever it's 25 paintbrushes for this was three dollars Canadian
Union yet em even cheaper in other places of the state it is all that you
need you are not painting miniatures you don't need high detail brushes you're
not painting beautiful landscape portraits with expensive oil paint you
don't need this you're just putting cheap paints on some styrofoam or
cardboard for people play a game on cheap brushes so you get yourself
something like that the first thing you need to know is that about half of these
are garbage and pretty much useful open it up these two sponge brushes maybe you
can kind of find a use for them but for the most part they will sit there and
once you use them to sponge paint something and then you won't clean them
and then they'll dry out and they'll be just garbage this big crappy brush has a
very limited use and it's not for painting I found one good use for it so
get something like this in your pack you can put it aside but it's not great for
painting in this pack and in many of the packs like this that I've seen there's a
wide variety of bristle types and they are not all created equal these packs
have a handful of brushes that have I think they are a natural hair like they
they might actually be like a horse hair but considering how cheap they're
they're probably I don't want to say badger because that's still too high
quality this is probably rat hair I don't know what it is but each one of
these packs always comes with a couple brushes with this with this type of hair
on it the reason that they're basically useless is that this hair is so soft
that you can't really it's hard to apply anything with it because they just bend
under the pressure when I you know first got these I thought maybe they'd be good
for applying glue and stuff but they're just so soft it so useless crap throw
them out so then there are usually a couple that have another type of natural
bristle that's really really really coarse and stiff and a couple that are
black and synthetic and really really really stiff I found that these are
pretty much useless for painting but they are okay for mixing stuff for when
you're putting glue on or like a sludgy mix of who knows what and you're going
to ruin a brush these are worth keeping and putting aside for that type of thing
but I wouldn't really use them for painting too much and then after that
you are going to be left most likely with the selection like this these are
soft synthetic bristles some are white some are this orange kind of gold color
but they're essentially the same these right here from that three dollar pack
are enough to make every bit of terrain that I've ever shown on this channel you
can paint your dungeon tiles you can paint scenery
you can paint elaborate detail buildings little props with these brushes that's
all that you need usually there's going to be at one big
one that's going to be about a three-quarter inch or an inch this is
going to be probably your most useful brush this is what you're going to use
to do your base coat and it's also excellent or dry brushing little ones
obviously just for smaller detailed stuff the one downside with these cheap
dollar-store brush kits is that they don't come with any really fine tipped
paint brushes so that's where you are going to find that you are lacking but
probably if you're just starting out and you're watching this video to learn what
to buy you're not going to be building stuff that requires that level of detail
yet but when you move forward and you progress and you've gotten comfortable
with things you might want to upgrade to some finer detail brushes but again you
don't need to buy expensive model brushes for detail work I have a set of
these detailed brushes that are from Walmart I can't remember exactly how
much they are but for a set of several of these brushes that have very fine
tips it's very affordable much cheaper than the stuff you're going to find
in the art supply store so when you want to upgrade to some fine detail brushes
you can check the art pile in a place like Walmart and get some really cheap
fine gift brushes in case you're interested these ones in specific our
company called dollar and Rowney and I think they're called detail brushes
they're cheap and they get the job done like I said this brush is going to be
your most useful and you may find that you want to have a couple of them and
maybe eventually you want to upgrade to something a little bit nicer there is a
line of brushes that craft smart cells via Michaels there are these blue ones
with these kind of rubber silicone grips and these are really nice you can get a
set of these for a few bucks they're pretty cheap and these are actually the
first brushes I bought and what I use for a long time and when I wore them out
about another set but then I actually ended up buying the cheap dollar store
ones later and I think these are all I'm going to buy moving forward and I'll
just keep one set of these that I try to keep nice and clean for when I don't
want to use a little bit better brush on something that's basically all you need
to start Hansol the brushes once you have them and you start using them I
recommend trying to keep them clean learn how to wash your brushes use some
dish soap try not to let them dry out too much and
try to separate the brushes that you use for stuff like glue from the ones that
use for paint but you will inevitably end up with a whole bunch of brushes
that end up really Haggard looking bent tips and hard at the base just because
it happens like you when you're crafting sometimes you just don't keep things
clean or your paint and glue dabbing on or there's sand and whatever so don't
throw those brushes out when your brushes start to get crappy put that in
a separate container so when you're painting you have nice brushes and when
you're applying stuff like glue you have crappy brushes use those for that and
that's basically it just like the craft paint it's not
complicated don't overthink it buy some cheap brushes try them out if you find
out that this hobby ain't for you then you're not wasting a bunch of money
up front if you really get into it you keep
building you might realize that these brushes are fine and you just keep using
cheap brushes or maybe you want to upgrade as your hobby progresses and you
can do that but I'm telling you start from the bottom with the cheapest ones
you can find and move up slowly from there so I hope you found this video
helpful I'm going to continue on this series if there's particular items
either techniques cereals or tools that you would like me to cover in this very
basic series put a comment below and I'll add it to the list and if you found
this video helpful please hit that like button drop the comment below
most importantly if you'd like to help me and help this channel the best way
that you can do that is by supporting black magic crafts on patreon all of the
funds that you guys donate via patreon allow me to invest a lot more time into
this channel it also allows me to upgrade equipment and buy things for
videos and it goes a long way and I really appreciate it guys click on that
link link is also in the description below love you all see you next time
Cheers
